summary: This is an email from the National Suicide Prevention Coordinator of the Federal Bureau of Prisons to an unspecified warden, scheduling a 'Psychological Reconstruction' for inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The email outlines logistical details for the visit, including dates, accommodations, and a request for document preparation and staff assistance.

persons.name: Epstein, Jeffrey
persons.context: The subject of the scheduled 'Psychological Reconstruction' at the prison. He is referred to as 'inmate Epstein'.

persons.name: Nagle, Robert
persons.context: Appears as a contact file (vcf) attached to the email. No specific role in the document's narrative is described.

events.title: Psychological Reconstruction of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A scheduled multi-day 'Psychological Reconstruction' assessment for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, to be conducted by the National Suicide Prevention Coordinator and a Correctional Services Administrator.

locations: Sheraton Tribeca on 370 Canal Street (New York, NY)
Federal Bureau of Prisons Psychology Services Branch, 320 First Street, NW, Washington, DC 20534
keyFacts: A 'Psychological Reconstruction' for Jeffrey Epstein was scheduled to begin on Tuesday, August 13, 2019.
The assessment was to be conducted by the National Suicide Prevention Coordinator of the Federal Bureau of Prisons.
The email was sent on August 12, 2019, the day before Epstein's death, indicating active planning for his psychological evaluation.
The coordinator requested assistance from prison staff to gather documents and facilitate interviews for the reconstruction.
The team planned to stay at the Sheraton Tribeca in New York and required transportation to the institution.
